html:
Updates

** Facebook owner's shares FB.O plunge 23.6% to $246.73

** Co set for its worst day ever and on course to erase more $200 bln in market cap, putting it at risk of losing its spot as the sixth-largest U.S. company to Berkshire Hathaway BRKa.N

** FB forecast Q1 revenue between $27 bln and $29 bln, below analysts' estimates of $29.33 bln (Full Story)

** It also posted a dip in daily active users for the first time, to 1.929 bln from 1.930 bln

** "Q1 growth headwinds reflect a 'perfect storm.' Our concerns about the near-term growth outlook for Meta were not only realized, but worse than we thought" - Baird Equity Research

** FB is sacrificing its core business model for its fascination with the metaverse, which will take at least another decade to really get going - data and analytics firm GlobalData

** Cos that rely on online ads including Snap Inc SNAP.N, Pinterest Inc PINS.N, Twitter Inc TWTR.N and Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O fell between 2.9% and 14.6% before the bell

** 50 of 60 brokerages rate FB "buy" or higher, 9 "hold" and 1 "sell" or lower; their median PT is $385

** Up to last close, FB had fallen ~2% since it last reported results on Oct. 25


(Reporting by Akash Sriram in Bengaluru)
